Max.Action: Wrestles playfully and happily with the dog, showing joyful friendliness.
Runs excitedly to show his sister the igloo he built, seeking connection.
His sister ignores him, and Max does not show frustration or negativity in response (no visible negative reaction).
Builds a snow igloo independently and shows pride in his creation.
Attempts to get sister's attention but fails due to her distraction.
Offers to play with friends and creates a fort to engage in imaginative play.
Kicks fence and shouts orders at it when it doesn’t respond.
Excitedly prepares and throws snowballs at teenagers entering his house.
Is crushed and dejected when told to go play with friends instead of joining others.
Launches a snowball attack on teenagers in play, showing readiness to engage and have fun.
Bolts and hides when threatened, showing self-preservation rather than aggression.
Is visibly upset and humiliated after being trapped and attacked, showing vulnerability and emotional openness.
Looks for Claire seeking comfort and support, indicating trust and friendliness.
Becomes upset and destructive in Claire’s room after being rejected, throwing his hat and gloves and making a mess.
Bolts and retreats promptly when the fight escalates, ensuring his safety by reaching his fort.
Claws his way out of the collapsing fort roof, showing quick reflexes and determination to escape danger.
Hopes for comfort and support from Claire, but fails to seek it actively or assertively when she ignores him.
Runs upstairs and vents frustration by jumping on Claire’s bed and making a mess, not effectively managing his emotions.
Realizes he has damaged the valentine he made and picks up the pieces, showing reflection and a willingness to acknowledge mistakes.

Smiles back at his mom after finishing the story, sharing a warm moment.

Looks around his room after lack of response from mom, considering his options.
Shows impatience and dissatisfaction with his mom's cooking by rolling his eyes, loudly dropping the frozen corn, and questioning it.
Follows his mom into the kitchen and interacts with her even though she seems distracted.
Looks around the room for appropriate activities but rejects armor, basketball hoop, and Lego set before choosing his wolf suit.
Struts downstairs confidently wearing his wolf suit, showing self-assurance.
Observes his mother and her boyfriend’s interaction and responds with mortification and disgust, showing awareness of social context.
Drags a chair lazily with noise and sniffs around kitchen food disrespectfully, showing lack of tact and patience.

Yells at his sister to get her stuff off the table.

Bites his mom, causing her pain and shock.

Runs away from home into the night and forest.
Bites his mom in a moment of rage, then instantly shows shock and realizes he has gone too far.
Runs away quickly through difficult terrain at night, cutting across yards and down an embankment, losing his pursuer.
Is unable to control his emotions and lashes out violently.
Looks around to see if anyone is there before taking the boat, wonders if the boat has an owner or if anyone is watching.
Pulls the boat back slowly, cautious about taking it.
Assesses the island after arriving, uses the environment to his advantage and plans his next moves carefully.

Observes the creatures and their behaviors attentively without immediate confrontation, showing patience and intelligence.
Crushes one of the huts with his arms, using his physical strength and possibly asserting dominance or testing boundaries.
